intro: Palicourea jatun-sachensis, commonly known as the Andean moonflower, is a climbing shrub native to the highlands of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with ornamental and medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves, and it produces small, fragrant flowers that bloom at night. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Due to its habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
